page.title: 16Farming In Hill Ridware.
page.content: The name of the farm is Manor Farm of Wade Lane.The size of the farm is 300 acres.There is a rota system for land utilisation the system is as follows Grass, Wheat, Barley,Potatoes and then Grass again in a 4 year rotation.There are 175 sheep,300 cattle and some horses.Bad weather damages 5% of crops. Animal food consists of grass,hay,corn,silage,oats and special pellets.The farmer grows 400 tons of corn.Crop diseases are prevented by spraying and rotation.Animals are dipped,injected and wormed.One cow produces 6-8 litres daily.His busiest time is spring lambing and autumn harvesting.Wheat and potatoes are sold but the rest is used for animal foods. Mining subsidence has created a large lake.Hedges have been removed for larger fields.Work begins at 5.30 am.
